name: Bacon Gnocchi Bake
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Bring a pot of salted water to boil and cook the gnocchi until it floats. In a large oven safe pan, cook the bacon until crisp and fat is rendered. Drain most of the fat and add garlic and paprika. Add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, and heavy cream. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add the gnocchi and mix, then top with the mozzarella and bake for 10 minutes until the cheese is melted and golden. Rest for 5 minutes and serve!

name: Baked Potato Soup
instructions: Preheat oven to 400. Pierce potatoes with a fork; bake at 400 for 1 hour or until tender. Cool. Peel potatoes; coarsely mash. Discard skins. Lightly spoon flour into a dry measuring cup; level with a knife. Place flour in a large Dutch oven; gradually add milk, stirring with a whisk until blended. Cook over medium heat until thick and bubbly (about 8 minutes). Add mashed potatoes, ¾ c. cheese, salt and pepper, stirring until cheese melts. Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream and ½ c. onions. Cook over low heat 10 minutes or until thoroughly heated (do not boil). Sprinkle each serving lightly with cheese onions & bacon.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions. In a skillet, cook bacon until crispy, then remove and chop. In a bowl, beat the eggs and mix with parmesan cheese and pepper. Once spaghetti is cooked, drain and toss with the bacon and garlic in the skillet. Remove from heat and stir in the egg mixture until creamy. Garnish with parsley and serve.

name: Chicken Parmesan
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Beat the eggs and dip the chicken breasts in the egg wash, then coat in the breadcrumbs and parmesan mixture. Heat olive oil in a skillet and cook the chicken until golden brown on both sides. Transfer to a baking dish, top with marinara sauce and mozzarella. Bake for 25 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.

name: Veggie Stir Fry
instructions: Heat olive oil and sesame oil in a wok. Add garlic and stir fry until fragrant. Add vegetables and stir fry until tender. Add soy sauce and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Serve with rice or noodles.

name: Lasagna
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Cook the lasagna noodles according to package directions. In a pan, cook the ground beef until browned, then add marinara sauce. In a separate bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, and parmesan. In a baking dish, layer noodles, sauce, ricotta mixture, and mozzarella. Repeat layers, finishing with mozzarella. Bake for 45 minutes, then let rest before serving.

name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
instructions: Butter one side of each slice of bread. Place one slice of cheese between two slices of bread, butter side out. Grill in a skillet over medium heat for 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown and the cheese is melted.

name: Pan-Seared Steak
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Season steaks with salt and pepper, then sear on both sides for about 4-5 minutes per side for medium rare. Add butter, garlic, and rosemary to the skillet and baste the steaks. Rest the steaks for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Macaroni and Cheese
instructions: Cook macaroni according to package directions. In a pan, melt butter and whisk in flour to form a roux. Gradually add milk while stirring until thickened. Stir in cheese, salt, and pepper. Combine with cooked macaroni and serve.

name: Chicken Salad
instructions: Chop the cooked chicken into bite-sized pieces. In a bowl, mix the chicken, celery, grapes, and almonds. Add mayonnaise and stir to combine. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

name: Beef Tacos
instructions: Cook the ground beef in a skillet until browned, then add taco seasoning and water according to package instructions. Warm taco shells in the oven, then fill with beef mixture and toppings like lettuce, cheese, tomatoes, and sour cream.

name: Chicken Stir Fry
instructions: Cut chicken into strips. Heat olive oil in a wok and stir fry the chicken until cooked. Add garlic and vegetables and stir fry until tender. Add soy sauce and cook for another 2 minutes. Serve with rice.

name: Chocolate Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix dry ingredients in a bowl. Beat eggs and butter in a separate bowl. Add milk and vanilla, then combine all ingredients. Pour into a greased cake pan and bake for 30 minutes.

name: Shrimp Scampi
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. In a skillet, heat olive oil and butter over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant. Add shrimp, salt, and pepper, cooking until shrimp turns pink. Add white wine and lemon juice, then simmer for 2-3 minutes. Toss with cooked spaghetti and parsley. Serve immediately.

name: Vegetable Soup
instructions: In a large pot, sauté onions and garlic until fragrant. Add chopped carrots, celery, potatoes, and zucchini. Pour in vegetable broth, diced tomatoes, green beans, and corn. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes until vegetables are tender. Adjust seasoning if necessary and serve warm.
